title: Home
content: Home Based on the Hjem tooling, Hjem Rum (literally meaning "home rooms") is a  collection of modules for various programs and services to simplify the use of  Hjem for managing your   files. Hjem was initially created as an improved implementation of the home  functionality that Home Manager provides. Its purpose was minimal. Hjem Rum's  purpose is to create a module collection based on that tooling in order to  recreate the functionality that Home Manager's large collection of modules  provides, allowing you to simply install and config a program.

title: Option: _module.args
content:
Additional arguments passed to each module in addition to ones
like `lib`, `config`,
and `pkgs`, `modulesPath`.

This option is also available to all submodules. Submodules do not
inherit args from their parent module, nor do they provide args to
their parent module or sibling submodules. The sole exception to
this is the argument `name` which is provided by
parent modules to a submodule and contains the attribute name
the submodule is bound to, or a unique generated name if it is
not bound to an attribute.

Some arguments are already passed by default, of which the
following *cannot* be changed with this option:
- {var}`lib`: The nixpkgs library.
- {var}`config`: The results of all options after merging the values from all modules together.
- {var}`options`: The options declared in all modules.
- {var}`specialArgs`: The `specialArgs` argument passed to `evalModules`.
- All attributes of {var}`specialArgs`

  Whereas option values can generally depend on other option values
  thanks to laziness, this does not apply to `imports`, which
  must be computed statically before anything else.

  For this reason, callers of the module system can provide `specialArgs`
  which are available during import resolution.

  For NixOS, `specialArgs` includes
  {var}`modulesPath`, which allows you to import
  extra modules from the nixpkgs package tree without having to
  somehow make the module aware of the location of the
  `nixpkgs` or NixOS directories.
  ```
  { modulesPath, ... }: {
    imports = [
      (modulesPath + "/profiles/minimal.nix")
    ];
  }
  ```

For NixOS, the default value for this option includes at least this argument:
- {var}`pkgs`: The nixpkgs package set according to
  the {option}`nixpkgs.pkgs` option.

title: Option: rum.gtk.bookmarks
content:
Bookmarks used by GTK file managers (ex. Nautilus).
Each entry should have one of the following formats:
- `[uri]`
- `[uri] <display name>`

title: Option: rum.gtk.css.gtk3
content:
CSS to be written to `~/.config/gtk-3.0/gtk.css`.
You can either use this as lines or you can reference
a CSS file from your theme's package (or both).

title: Option: rum.gtk.css.gtk4
content:
CSS to be written to `~/.config/gtk-4.0/gtk.css`.
You can either use this as lines or you can reference
a CSS file from your theme's package (or both).

title: Option: rum.gtk.enable
content: Whether to enable GTK configuration.

title: Option: rum.gtk.packages
content:
The list of packages to be installed for gtk themes.
This list should consist of any packages that will be used
by your GTK theme(s).

title: Option: rum.gtk.settings
content:
The settings that will be written to the various gtk files
to configure the GTK theme. GTK documentation is perhaps
nebulous, but the Arch Wiki entry and the official GTK
documentation (https://docs.gtk.org/gtk3/class.Settings.html)
are decent places to start.

Please note that each option name will have "gtk-" prepended
to it, so there is no need to include that on every single option.

title: Option: rum.programs.alacritty.enable
content: Whether to enable Alacritty.

title: Option: rum.programs.alacritty.package
content: The alacritty package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.alacritty.settings
content:
The configuration converted into TOML and written to
`~/.config/alacritty/alacritty.toml`.
Please reference https://alacritty.org/config-alacritty.html
for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.foot.enable
content: Whether to enable foot.

title: Option: rum.programs.foot.package
content: The foot package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.foot.settings
content:
Settings are written as an INI file to ~/.config/foot/foot.ini.

Refer to https://codeberg.org/dnkl/foot/src/branch/master/foot.ini for
all available options.

title: Option: rum.programs.fuzzel.enable
content: Whether to enable fuzzel.

title: Option: rum.programs.fuzzel.package
content: The fuzzel package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.fuzzel.settings
content:
Is written to `~/fuzzel/fuzzel.ini`.

Consult [man 5 fuzzel.ini](https://www.mankier.com/5/fuzzel.ini).

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.enable
content: Whether to enable Ghostty.

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.package
content: The ghostty package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.settings
content:
The configuration converted to INI and written to `~/.config/ghostty/config`.
Please reference https://ghostty.org/docs/config/reference for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.themes
content:
An attribute set of themes, with the key as the theme name.
Please reference https://ghostty.org/docs/features/theme for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.destination
content:
Select your preferred git config location. Do note that options set in
`~/.gitconfig` will shadow anything set in `.config/git/config`.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.enable
content: Whether to enable git.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.package
content: The git package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.settings
content: Settings that will be written to your configuration file.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.enable
content: Whether to enable Helix.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.languages
content:
The languages configurations converted into TOML and written to
`~/.config/helix/languages.toml`.
Please reference https://docs.helix-editor.com/languages.html
for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.package
content: The helix package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.settings
content:
The editor configuration converted into TOML and written to
`~/.config/helix/config.toml`.
Please reference https://docs.helix-editor.com/editor.html
and https://docs.helix-editor.com/remapping.html for config
options.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.themes
content:
The custom themes converted into TOML and written to
`~/.config/helix/themes/`.
Please reference https://docs.helix-editor.com/themes.html
for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprland.enable
content: Whether to enable Hyprland.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprland.extraConfig
content: Extra configuration that will be appended verbatim at the end of your `hyprland.conf`.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprland.importantPrefixes
content: List of prefix of attributes to source at the top of the config.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprland.plugins
content:
List of Hyprland plugins to use. Can either be packages or
absolute plugin paths.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprland.settings
content:
Hyprland configuration written in Nix. Entries with the same key
should be written as lists. Variables' and colors' names should be
quoted. See <https://wiki.hyprland.org> for more examples.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprlock.enable
content: Whether to enable hyprlock.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprlock.package
content: The hyprlock package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprlock.settings
content:
Is written to `~/hypr/hyprlock.conf`.

Configuration options can be found on the [Hyprland Wiki](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Hypr-Ecosystem/hyprlock).

title: Option: rum.programs.keepassxc.enable
content: Whether to enable KeePassXC.

title: Option: rum.programs.keepassxc.package
content: The keepassxc package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.keepassxc.settings
content:
Settings are written as an INI file to ~/.config/keepassxc/keepassxc.ini.

Please consult https://keepassxc.org/docs/KeePassXC_UserGuide, but also
a configuration you create by toggling options through the GUI, as it
doesn't seem they are documented.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.colors
content:
Configuration written to `~/.config/lsd/colors.yaml`, defining the colors used by
lsd.
Please reference https://github.com/lsd-rs/lsd#color-theme-file-content to configure it accordingly.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.enable
content: Whether to enable LSD (LSDeluxe).

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.icons
content:
Configuration written to `~/.config/lsd/icons.yaml`, defining the icons used by
lsd.
Please reference https://github.com/lsd-rs/lsd#icon-theme to configure it accordingly.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.package
content: The lsd package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.settings
content:
Configuration written to `~/.config/lsd/config.yaml`, defining lsd settings.
Please reference https://github.com/lsd-rs/lsd#config-file-content to configure it accordingly.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings
content:
Custom bindings configuration written to `~/.config/ncmpcpp/bindings`.
       Please reference ncmpcpp(1) (ncmpcpp's man page) to configure it accordingly, or access
       https://github.com/ncmpcpp/ncmpcpp/blob/master/doc/bindings for an example.

The lists are separated between keys, for actions ran on keypresses, and commands, for
actions ran on commands. The option's example demonstrates this greatly.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.<name>.*.actions
content: The actions to be ran on either the key's or command's activation.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.<name>.*.binding
content: The key or command for which the set of actions is binded to.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.<name>.*.deferred
content: Whether the binding or command should be deferred (true) or immediate (false).

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.enable
content:
Whether to enable Enables the rum module for ncmpcpp, a mpd-based music player.
.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.package
content:
The ncmpcpp package to use. You can use an override to toggle certain features like the visualizer, a clock screen, and more.
       Please check out the package source for a complete list.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.settings
content:
Configuration written to `~/.config/ncmpcpp/config`.
Please reference ncmpcpp(1) (ncmpcpp's man page) to configure it accordingly, or access
https://github.com/ncmpcpp/ncmpcpp/blob/master/doc/config for an example.

title: Option: rum.programs.obs-studio.enable
content: Whether to enable OBS Studio.

title: Option: rum.programs.obs-studio.package
content: The obs-studio package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.obs-studio.plugins
content:
A list of plugins the obs-studio package will be wrapped with.
Set of plugins available in nixpkgs under the obs-studio-plugins set.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.enable
content: Whether to enable spotify_player.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.keymap
content:
Sets of keymaps and actions converted into TOML and written to
`~/.config/spotify-player/keymap.toml`.
See example for how to format declarations.

Please reference https://github.com/aome510/spotify-player/blob/master/docs/config.md#keymaps
for more information.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.package
content: The spotify-player package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.settings
content:
The configuration converted into TOML and written to
`~/.config/spotify-player/app.toml`.

Please reference https://github.com/aome510/spotify-player/blob/master/docs/config.md#general
for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.themes
content:
The theme converted into TOML and written to
`~/.config/spotify-player/themes.toml`.

Please reference https://github.com/aome510/spotify-player/blob/master/docs/config.md#themes
for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.enable
content: Whether to enable starship module..

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.package
content: The starship package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.settings
content:
The configuration converted to TOML and written to `~/.config/starship.toml`.
Please reference https://starship.rs/config/ for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.tofi.enable
content: Whether to enable tofi.

title: Option: rum.programs.tofi.package
content: The tofi package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.tofi.settings
content:
The configuration converted into "key = value" and written to
`~/.config/tofi/config`.
Please reference tofi(5) (manpage) at https://github.com/philj56/tofi/blob/master/doc/tofi.5.md,
or see an example at https://github.com/philj56/tofi/blob/master/doc/config.

title: Option: rum.programs.vscode.enable
content: Whether to enable Visual Studio Code.

title: Option: rum.programs.vscode.package
content: The vscode package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.vscode.settings
content:
The configuration converted into JSON and written to
`~/.config/Code/User/settings.json`.

Please reference https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/settings#_settings-json-file
for more info.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable zsh module..

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.initConfig
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file}`.zshrc`.;

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.integrations.starship.enable
content: Whether to enable starship integration.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.loginConfig
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file}`.zlogin`.;

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.logoutConfig
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file}`.zlogout`.;

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.package
content: The zsh package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins
content:
An attrset of plugins to load into zsh. Configuration of the former can be done and is advised to be
done at this level, for the sake of organization.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins.<name>.completions
content: A list of completions that will be loaded into `fpath`.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins.<name>.config
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file}`.zshrc` right after the plugin import..;

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins.<name>.source
content: Path to the plugin file to load.
